Token.Abstract: This class contains media manager and playback manager to manage the Camera's media content. Also, it provides methods to change settings of the camera and perform actions of the camera.
Delegate that recevies the information pushed by the camera
Delegate that recevies the information pushed by the camera
Delegate that recevies the information pushed by the camera
Media Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModeMediaDownload. User can only access to the manager when isMediaDownloadModeSupported returns YES.
Media Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModeMediaDownload. User can only access to the manager when isMediaDownloadModeSupported returns YES.
Media Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModeMediaDownload. User can only access to the manager when isMediaDownloadModeSupported returns YES.
Playback Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModePlayback. User can only access to the manager when isPlaybackSupported returns YES.
Playback Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModePlayback. User can only access to the manager when isPlaybackSupported returns YES.
Playback Manager is used for interaction when camera is in DJICameraModePlayback. User can only access to the manager when isPlaybackSupported returns YES.

Sets the camera's work mode to taking pictures, video, playback or download. See enum DJICameraMode in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find details on camera work modes. Please note that you cannot change the mode when a certain task is executing, e.g. taking photo(s), recording video, downloading and saving files.

Parameter.Name: mode
Parameter.Abstract: Camera work mode.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's current work mode.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Check if the current device supports Timelapse. Supported only by OSMO camera.
Camera starts to take photo with one of the camera capture modes (shoot photo modes).

Parameter.Name: shootMode
Parameter.Abstract: Shoot photo mode for camera to start taking photos with. Check the enum named CameraShootPhotoMode in DJICameraSettingsDef to find all possible camera shoot modes.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Camera stops taking photos.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Check if the current device supports Slow Motion video recording. Currently Slow Motion is supported only by the OSMO camera.

Sets whether Slow Motion mode is enabled or not. When it is enabled, the resolution and frame rate will change to 1920x1080 120fps. When it is disabled, the reolution and frame rate will recover to previous setting. Supported only by OSMO camera.

Parameter.Name: enabled
Parameter.Abstract: Enable or disable Slow Motion video.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets whether Slow Motion mode is enabled or not. Supported only by the OSMO camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Starts recording video. Camera must be in DJICameraModeRecordVideo work mode.
Stops recording video.
Check if the current device supports Playback Mode
Sets the camera's file index mode. The default value of DJICameraFileIndexMode is set to DJICameraFileIndexModeReset.

Parameter.Name: fileIndex
Parameter.Abstract: File index mode to be set for the camera's SD card.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's file index mode.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's video resolution and frame rate.

Parameter.Name: resolution
Parameter.Abstract: Resolution to be set for the video.

Parameter.Name: rate
Parameter.Abstract: Frame rate to be set for the video.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's video resolution and frame rate values.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getVideoResolutionAndFrameRateWithCompletion:(void ( ^ ) ( DJICameraVideoResolution resolution , DJICameraVideoFrameRate rate , NSError *_Nullable error ))block

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's video file format. The default value is DJICameraVideoFileFormatMOV.

Parameter.Name: format
Parameter.Abstract: Video file format to be set for videos.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's video file format.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block to return the current video file format.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's analog video standard. Setting the video standard to PAL or NTSC will limit the available resolutions and frame rates to those compatible with the chosen video standard.

Parameter.Name: videoStandard
Parameter.Abstract: Video standard value to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: result
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's video standard value.
Sets the camera's aspect ratio for photos. Check the enum named DJICameraPhotoAspectRatio in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible ratios.

Parameter.Name: ratio
Parameter.Abstract: Aspect ratio for photos to be taken by camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's aspect ratio for photos.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's photo quality for JPEG images. Check the enum named DJICameraPhotoQuality in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible camera photo qualities.

Parameter.Name: quality
Parameter.Abstract: Camera photo quality to set to.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's photo quality.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's photo file format. Check the enum named DJICameraPhotoFileFormat in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible photo formats the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: photoFormat
Parameter.Abstract: Photo file format used when the camera takes a photo.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's photo file format.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets burst shoot count for the camera, for the case when the user wants to use burst shoot. Check the enum named DJICameraPhotoBurstCount in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible burst count values the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: count
Parameter.Abstract: The number of photos to take in one burst shoot

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the burst count type.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's AEB capture parameters.

Parameter.Name: aebParam
Parameter.Abstract: AEB capture parameters to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's AEB capture parameters.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the interval shoot parameters. The camera will capture a photo, wait a specified interval of time, take another photo, and continue in this manner until it has taken the required number of photos.

Parameter.Name: count
Parameter.Abstract: The number of photos to capture. The value should fall in [2, 255]. If the value of captureCount is set to 255, the camera will continue to take photos at the specified interval until stopShootPhotoWithCompletion is called.

Parameter.Name: interval
Parameter.Abstract: The time interval between when two photos are taken. The range for this parameter depends the photo file format(DJICameraPhotoFileFormat). When the file format is JPEG, the range is [2, 2^16-1] seconds. When the file format is RAW or RAW+JPEG, the range is [10, 2^16-1] seconds. Inspire PRO is an exception. The range for Inspire PRO is [5, 2^16-1] seconds for all formats.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's interval shoot parameters.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the TimeLapse parameters including interval, duration and file format when saving.

Parameter.Name: interval
Parameter.Abstract: The time between image captures. An integer falls in the range, [10, 8191]. The unit is 100ms. Please note that when the format is JPEG+Video, the minimum interval is 20(2 seconds).

Parameter.Name: duration
Parameter.Abstract: The time for the whole action. An integer falls in the range, [0, 2^31-1] seconds. If the value is set to be 0, it means that it shoots forever until invoking stopShootPhoto method.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution block with the execution result returned.

Parameter.Name: fileFormat
Parameter.Abstract: A enum type of the file format to be used. Please refer to DJICameraPhotoTimeLapseFileFormat in DJICameraSettingsDef.

Token.Abstract: Supported only by OSMO camera. Gets the TimeLapse parameters including interval, duration and file format when saving.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getPhotoTimeLapseIntervalDurationAndFileFormatWithCompletion:(void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger interval , NSUInteger duration , DJICameraPhotoTimeLapseFileFormat format , NSError *_Nullable error ))block

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's exposure mode. Check the enum named DJICameraExposureMode in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible camera exposure modes.

Parameter.Name: mode
Parameter.Abstract: Camera exposure mode to set to.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's exposure mode.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's ISO value. Check the enum named DJICameraISO in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible ISO options that the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: iso
Parameter.Abstract: ISO value to be set.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's ISO value.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera shutter speed. For all available values shutterSpeed can be set to, check the top of DJICameraSettingsDef.h.

Parameter.Name: shutterSpeed
Parameter.Abstract: Shutter speed value to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's shutter speed.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's exposure metering. Check the enum named DJICameraMeteringMode in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible exposure metering the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: meteringType
Parameter.Abstract: Exposure metering to be set.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's exposure metering.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the spot metering area index. The camera image is divided into 96 spots defined by 12 columns and 8 rows. The row index falls in [0,7] where the values increase top to bottom across the image. The column index falls in [0, 11], where the values increase left to right. In order to make the method work, The camera exposure mode should be 'Program', 'Shutter' or 'Aperture' and the exposure metering mode should be DJICameraMeteringModeSpot.

Parameter.Name: rowIndex
Parameter.Abstract: Spot metering area row index to be set.

Parameter.Name: colIndex
Parameter.Abstract: Spot metering area column index to be set.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the spot metering area row index and column index.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getSpotMeteringAreaRowIndexAndColIndexWithCompletion:(void ( ^ ) ( uint8_t rowIndex , uint8_t colIndex , NSError *_Nullable error ))block

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's exposure compensation. Check the enum named DJICameraExposureCompensation in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible exposure compensations the camera can be set to. In order to use this function, the camera exposure mode should be 'shutter', 'program' or 'aperture'.

Parameter.Name: compensationType
Parameter.Abstract: Exposure compensation value to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's exposure compensation.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets whether or not the camera's AE (auto exposure) lock is locked or not.

Parameter.Name: isLock
Parameter.Abstract: YES if the camera AE lock is locked or unlocked.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets if the camera's AE (auto exposure) lock is locked or not.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the cameraâ€™s white balance and color temperature.

Parameter.Name: whiteBalance
Parameter.Abstract: White balance value to be set.

Parameter.Name: colorTemperature
Parameter.Abstract: Color temperature value to be set in the range of [20, 100]. Real color temperature value(K) = value * 100. For example, 50 -> 5000K.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's white balance and color temperature.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getWhiteBalanceAndColorTemperatureWithCompletion:(void ( ^ ) ( DJICameraWhiteBalance whiteBalance , uint8_t colorTemperature , NSError *_Nullable error ))block

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's anti-flicker for video recording.

Parameter.Name: antiFlickerType
Parameter.Abstract: Anti-flicker value to set for the camera. Please check the enum DJICameraAntiFlicker to find all the possible anti-flicker type the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's anti-flicker.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's sharpness. Check the enum named DJICameraSharpness in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible sharpnesss the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: sharpness
Parameter.Abstract: Sharpness value to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's sharpness.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's contrast. Check the enum named DJICameraContrast in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible contrasts the camera can be set to.

Parameter.Name: contrast
Parameter.Abstract: Contrast value to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's contrast.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Completion block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's saturation. The default value of the saturation value is 0.

Parameter.Name: saturation
Parameter.Abstract: Saturation value to be set in the range of [-3, 3].

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's saturation.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's hue. The default value of the saturation value is 0.

Parameter.Name: hue
Parameter.Abstract: Hue value to be set in the range of [-3, 3].

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's hue.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Sets the camera's digital filter. The default value is DJICameraDigitalFilterNone. For a list of all possible camera digital filters, check the enum named DJICameraDigitalFilter in DJICameraSettingsDef.h.

Parameter.Name: filter
Parameter.Abstract: Digital filter to be set to the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's digital filter.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Returns whether or not the device supports quick view. Quick view is an amount of time a photo is shown as a preview after it is taken and before the camera returns back to the live camera view. seconds.

Sets the camera's quick view duration. The valid range is [0, 10] seconds. When duration is 0, it means that the quick view is disabled. The default value is 0 second. It is not supported by Phantom 3 Standard. Please check isPhotoQuickViewSupported before using this method.

Parameter.Name: duration
Parameter.Abstract: Quick view duration to be set for the camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Gets the camera's quick view duration.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Check if the current device supports audio recording. Currently audio recording is supported only by the OSMO camera.
Enables audio recording when capturing video. Supported only by OSMO camera.

Parameter.Name: enabled
Parameter.Abstract: Enable or disable audio recording.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Supported only by OSMO camera. Gets whether the audio record is enabled or not.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets whether the changeable lens is supported by the camera. Currently, a changeable lens is supported only by X5 camera.
Gets details of the installed lens. Supported only by X5 camera. It is available only when isChangeableLensSupported returns YES.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets whether the camera supports an adjustable aperture. Currently, adjustable aperture is supported only by X5 camera.
Sets the aperture value. It is available only when isAdjustableApertureSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: aperture
Parameter.Abstract: The aperture to set. Check enum CameraLensFocusMode in DJICameraSettingsDef.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets the lens aperture. It is available only when isAdjustableApertureSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets whether the camera supports an adjustable focal point. Currently, adjustable focal point is supported only by X5 camera.
Sets the lens focus mode. Check enum CameraLensFocusMode in DJICameraSettingsDef. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: focusMode
Parameter.Abstract: Focus mode to set. Please refer to DJICameraLensFocusMode for more detail.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets the lens focus mode. Please check enum CameraLensFocusMode in DJICameraSettingsDef. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Sets the lens focus Target point. When the focus mode is auto, the target point is the focal point. When the focus mode is manual, the target point is the zoom out area if the focus assistant is enabled for the manual mode. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: focusTarget
Parameter.Abstract: The focus target to set. The range for x and y is from 0.0 to 1.0. The point [0.0, 0.0] represents the top-left angle of the screen.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets the lens focus Target point. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Sets whether the lens focus assistant is enabled or not. If the focus assistant is enabled, a specific area of the screen will zoom out during focusing. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Parameter.Name: enabledAF
Parameter.Abstract: Sets whether the lens focus assistant under AF mode is enabled or not.

Parameter.Name: enabledMF
Parameter.Abstract: Sets whether the lens focus assistant under MF mode is enabled or not.

Token.Abstract: Gets whether the lens focus assistant is enabled or not. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getLensFocusAssistantEnabledForMFAndAFWithCompletion:(void ( ^ ) ( BOOL MFenabled , BOOL AFenabled , NSError *_Nullable error ))block

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned. The first result stands for MF, the second result stands for AF.

Token.Abstract: Gets the lens focusing ring value's max value. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Set the focal distance by simulating the focus ring adjustment. Value can have a range of [0, getLensFocusRingValueUpperBoundWithCompletion] which represents the closest possible focal distance and infinity. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: value
Parameter.Abstract: An integer value to adjust the focusing ring. The minimum value is 0, the maximum value depends on the installed lens. Please use method getLensFocusRingValueUpperBoundWithCompletion to ensure the input argument is valid.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Gets lens focus ring value. It is available only when isAdjustableFocalPointSupported returns YES. Supported only by X5 camera.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the value(s) returned.

Token.Abstract: Load the camera's factory settings.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The execution callback with the execution result returned.

Token.Abstract: Saves the current camera settings permanently to the specified user. Check the enum named DJICameraCustomSettings in DJICameraSettingsDef.h to find all possible camera users.

Parameter.Name: settings
Parameter.Abstract: Camera user to store camera settings to.

Parameter.Name: result
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Load camera settings from the specified user.

Parameter.Name: settings
Parameter.Abstract: Camera user to load camera settings from.

Parameter.Name: result
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result error block.

Token.Abstract: Formats the SD card by deleting all the data on the SD card. This does not change any settings the user may have set on the SD card.

Gets the current state of the SD card. For instance, accessing the sdInfo parameter of the block will tell you whether or not the SD card is inserted into the camera or how much memory is remaining. For more information on all possible current states of the SD card, refer to DJICameraSDCardState.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: Remote execution result callback block.

Token.Abstract: Check if the current device support Media Download Mode
